header: Cri.Bail Application no. 181/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000707-2019

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 23/19 registered at Dehuroad Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354(A)(D),504,506 of the Indian Penal Code and under section 12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 439 of cr.p.c. by applicant in respect of his arrest in c.r. no. 23/19 registered at dehuroad police station for the offence punishable under section 354(a)(d),504,506 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: It is alleged that mother of victim lodged report stating that victim aged about 16 years is studying in 9th std. in D.Y. Patil English Medium School, Akurdi. Applicant is residing at Adarsh Nagar and working as a watchman in the society of first informant. On 07.01.2019 at 9.00 p.m. applicant stared victim when she, her father went for bringing articles in the shop adjacent to society. Applicant whistled by seeing victim and made gestures. Victim came to house and started crying . Upon asking she narrated the incident. She also told that when she was using lift of the society, applicant used to make call on phone in the lift and was insisting to speak with him. He thereby outraged her modesty.

in D.Y. Patil English Medium School, Akurdi.
Applicant is residing at Adarsh Nagar and working as a watchman in the society of first informant.
On 07.01.2019 at 9.00 p.m. applicant stared victim when she, her father went for bringing articles in the shop adjacent to society.
Applicant whistled by seeing victim and made gestures.
Victim came to house and started crying .
Upon asking she narrated the incident.
She also told that when she was using lift of the society, applicant used to make call on phone in the lift and was insisting to speak with him.
He thereby outraged her modesty.

arguments.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. He is earning member of family and belongs to reputed family. He is permanently residing at Adarshnagar, Haveli, Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter.
He is earning member of family and belongs to reputed family.
He is permanently residing at Adarshnagar, Haveli, Pune.
He has no criminal antecedents.
He is ready to abide the conditions.
Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

arguments.text: 4] APP objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, he prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: 4] APP objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress.
Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses.
There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence.
So, he prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is sufficiently interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is resident of Adarshnagar, Haveli, Pune. He is doing labour work and his family members are depending on him. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

argumentSentences.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious.
Applicant is sufficiently interrogated.
Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over.
Personal custody of applicant is not required.
Applicant is resident of Adarshnagar, Haveli, Pune.
He is doing labour work and his family members are depending on him.
Applicant has no criminal antecedents.
No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period.
Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Manoj Kashinath Itkar be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.40,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Dehuroad Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not meet the victim and threat and pressurize the victim and shall not repeat the offence. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number.

processedText:
Cri.Bail Application no. 181/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000707-2019 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 23/19 registered at Dehuroad Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354(A)(D),504,506 of the Indian Penal Code and under section 12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. 
---background-ends---
It is alleged that mother of victim lodged report stating that victim aged about 16 years is studying in 9th std. in D.Y. Patil English Medium School, Akurdi. Applicant is residing at Adarsh Nagar and working as a watchman in the society of first informant. On 07.01.2019 at 9.00 p.m. applicant stared victim when she, her father went for bringing articles in the shop adjacent to society. Applicant whistled by seeing victim and made gestures. Victim came to house and started crying . Upon asking she narrated the incident. She also told that when she was using lift of the society, applicant used to make call on phone in the lift and was insisting to speak with him. He thereby outraged her modesty. 
---argument-ends---
3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. He is earning member of family and belongs to reputed family. He is permanently residing at Adarshnagar, Haveli, Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] APP objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, he prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is sufficiently interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is resident of Adarshnagar, Haveli, Pune. He is doing labour work and his family members are depending on him. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Manoj Kashinath Itkar be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.40,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Dehuroad Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not meet the victim and threat and pressurize the victim and shall not repeat the offence. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number. 
---order-ends---
Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 16.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 Cri.Bail Application no. 181/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000707-2019 “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ S.V.Thakar, Court Name ­ Smt. R.V.Adone, Addl.Sessions Judge,Pune. Date of Order ­ 16.01.2019 Order signed by P.O. ­ 17.01.2019 Order uploaded on ­ 17.01.2019
